required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Phase 2 Evaluation of TRC105 In Combination With Bevacizumab in Patients With Glioblastoma
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2 Evaluation of TRC105 In Combination With Bevacizumab for the Treatment Of Recurrent or Progressive Glioblastoma That Has Progressed on Bevacizumab

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety and efficacy of TRC105 in patients with recurrent or progressive glioblastoma after prior antiangiogenic therapy (including anti-VEGF therapy)

detailed_description.textblock: Angiogenesis plays a central role in the progression of solid cancer. TRC105 is an antibody to CD105, an important non-VEGF angiogenic target on proliferating endothelial cells. TRC105 inhibits angiogenesis, tumor growth and metastases in preclinical models. TRC105 has been well tolerated in patients with glioblastoma (GBM) as a single agent. The combination of TRC105 in combination with bevacizumab has demonstrated activity in bevacizumab refractory cancer patients. We hypothesize that TRC105 when administered with bevacizumab will have activity in GBM patients who progress on bevacizumab. By targeting a non-VEGF pathway, TRC105 has the potential to complement VEGF inhibition by bevacizumab, which could represent a major advance in GBM therapy.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: A total of 6 initial patients were treated with 10 mg/kg of TRC105 monotherapy. All patients progressed within 2 months of initiating treatment, reflecting the rapid progression. Due to the lack of activity in this disease setting with TRC105 alone, the study was amended to treat patients with 10 mg/kg TRC105 weekly in combination with 10 mg/kg bevacizumab every two weeks.

primary_outcome.description: Overall survival assessed by determination from time of informed consent on trial to the date of death of each patient enrolled in the trial

secondary_outcome.measure: Median Duration That Patients Remained Progression Free on Study
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Patients are scanned every 8 weeks for approximately 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: The median number of months that patients remained progression free was calculated using modified RANO criteria to determine progression. Modified RANO criteria is defined as follows: The largest cross-sectional area on the T1-weighted contrast-enhanced images was selected and measured in 2 dimensions with linear measures on the baseline MRI axial sequence. In addition, the largest cross-sectional area of a contiguous hyperintense lesion on FLAIR sequences was measured on the baseline MRI axial sequence. All subsequent scans were compared against these baseline measures (for both CE and FLAIR). New foci of FLAIR signal abnormality were recorded on each subsequent evaluation. Response was scored.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Adverse Events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Patients were followed for at least 28 days after the last dose of TRC105 study drug for adverse events, an average of 4 months
secondary_outcome.description: Adverse event frequency per patient according to CTCAE version 4.0.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients Who Respond to Study Treatment According to Modified RANO Criteria (Objective Response Rate (ORR)).
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients who respond to study treatment according to modified RANO criteria was calculated (Objective Response Rate (ORR)). Modified RANO criteria is defined as follows: The largest cross-sectional area on the T1-weighted contrast-enhanced images was selected and measured in 2 dimensions with linear measures on the baseline MRI axial sequence. In addition, the largest cross-sectional area of a contiguous hyperintense lesion on FLAIR sequences was measured on the baseline MRI axial sequence. All subsequent scans were compared against these baseline measures (for both CE and FLAIR). New foci of FLAIR signal abnormality were recorded on each subsequent evaluation. Response was scored.

intervention.description: 10 mg/kg weekly by intravenous administration on Days 1, 8, 15 and 22 of each 28-day cycle

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Patients with histologically confirmed glioblastoma, recurrent after prior external-beam fractionated radiotherapy and temozolomide chemotherapy.
2. Patients with documented radiographic progression following bevacizumab therapy for treatment of glioblastoma.
3. Patients with up to 3 prior recurrences are allowed.
4. Karnofsky performance status ≥ 70%.
5. Age ≥ 18 years old.
6. Normal organ function
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who have had previous treatment with TRC105.
- Patients who have undergone major surgery (e.g. intra-thoracic, intra-abdominal or intra-pelvic), open biopsy or significant traumatic injury ≤ 4 weeks prior to starting study drug, or patients who have had minor procedures, percutaneous biopsies or placement of vascular access device ≤ 1 week prior to starting study drug, or who have not recovered from side effects of such procedure or injury
- Patients with cirrhosis, or active viral or nonviral hepatitis.
- Patients with active bleeding or pathologic conditions that carry a high risk of bleeding,(i.e. hereditary hemorrhagic telangiectasia).
- Patients who are currently receiving anticoagulation treatment
- Patients unwilling or unable to comply with the protocol

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Patients were screened and enrolled at 4 sites

group.title: Carotuximab (TRC105), Bevacizumab
group.description: Single arm study Carotuximab (TRC105): 10 mg/kg weekly by intravenous administration on Days 1, 8, 15 and 22 of each 28-day cycle Bevacizumab: IV 10 mg/kg every 2 weeks

group.description: Single arm TRC105: 10 mg/kg weekly by intravenous administration on Days 1, 8, 15 and 22 of each 28-day cycle

class.title: Score = 70: Can care for self; not normal activity

outcome.title: Median Overall Survival (OS)
outcome.description: Overall survival assessed by determination from time of informed consent on trial to the date of death of each patient enrolled in the trial
outcome.population: Patients treated with TRC105 and bevacizumab who expired. Overall survival was not captured in the monotherapy portion of the study.

group.title: Carotuximab (TRC105), Bevacizumab
group.description: Single arm study Carotuximab (TRC105): 10 mg/kg weekly by intravenous administration on Days 1, 8, 15 and 22 of each 28-day cycle Bevacizumab: IV 10 mg/kg every 2 weeks

measure.title: Median Overall Survival (OS)
measure.description: Overall survival assessed by determination from time of informed consent on trial to the date of death of each patient enrolled in the trial
measure.population: Patients treated with TRC105 and bevacizumab who expired. Overall survival was not captured in the monotherapy portion of the study.

outcome.title: Median Duration That Patients Remained Progression Free on Study
outcome.description: The median number of months that patients remained progression free was calculated using modified RANO criteria to determine progression. Modified RANO criteria is defined as follows: The largest cross-sectional area on the T1-weighted contrast-enhanced images was selected and measured in 2 dimensions with linear measures on the baseline MRI axial sequence. In addition, the largest cross-sectional area of a contiguous hyperintense lesion on FLAIR sequences was measured on the baseline MRI axial sequence. All subsequent scans were compared against these baseline measures (for both CE and FLAIR). New foci of FLAIR signal abnormality were recorded on each subsequent evaluation. Response was scored.
outcome.time_frame: Patients are scanned every 8 weeks for approximately 6 months
outcome.population: Patients with at least 1 on study scan were included in the efficacy population. The number of months that patients remained progression free was calculated for 5 evaluable monotherapy patients and 14 evaluable combination therapy patients.

group.title: Carotuximab (TRC105), Bevacizumab
group.description: Single arm study Carotuximab (TRC105): 10 mg/kg weekly by intravenous administration on Days 1, 8, 15 and 22 of each 28-day cycle Bevacizumab: IV

measure.title: Median Duration That Patients Remained Progression Free on Study
measure.description: The median number of months that patients remained progression free was calculated using modified RANO criteria to determine progression. Modified RANO criteria is defined as follows: The largest cross-sectional area on the T1-weighted contrast-enhanced images was selected and measured in 2 dimensions with linear measures on the baseline MRI axial sequence. In addition, the largest cross-sectional area of a contiguous hyperintense lesion on FLAIR sequences was measured on the baseline MRI axial sequence. All subsequent scans were compared against these baseline measures (for both CE and FLAIR). New foci of FLAIR signal abnormality were recorded on each subsequent evaluation. Response was scored.
measure.population: Patients with at least 1 on study scan were included in the efficacy population. The number of months that patients remained progression free was calculated for 5 evaluable monotherapy patients and 14 evaluable combination therapy patients.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Adverse Events
outcome.description: Adverse event frequency per patient according to CTCAE version 4.0.
outcome.time_frame: Patients were followed for at least 28 days after the last dose of TRC105 study drug for adverse events, an average of 4 months
outcome.population: Patients who received at least a portion of a dose of TRC105 and/or Bevacizumab

group.title: Carotuximab (TRC105), Bevacizumab
group.description: Single arm study Carotuximab (TRC105): 10 mg/kg weekly by intravenous administration on Days 1, 8, 15 and 22 of each 28-day cycle Bevacizumab: IV 10 mg/kg every two weeks

group.title: Carotuximab (TRC105)
group.description: Single arm study Carotuximab (TRC105): 10 mg/kg weekly by intravenous administration on Days 1, 8, 15 and 22 of each 28-day cycle

measure.title: Number of Participants With Adverse Events
measure.description: Adverse event frequency per patient according to CTCAE version 4.0.
measure.population: Patients who received at least a portion of a dose of TRC105 and/or Bevacizumab

outcome.title: Number of Patients Who Respond to Study Treatment According to Modified RANO Criteria (Objective Response Rate (ORR)).
outcome.description: Number of patients who respond to study treatment according to modified RANO criteria was calculated (Objective Response Rate (ORR)). Modified RANO criteria is defined as follows: The largest cross-sectional area on the T1-weighted contrast-enhanced images was selected and measured in 2 dimensions with linear measures on the baseline MRI axial sequence. In addition, the largest cross-sectional area of a contiguous hyperintense lesion on FLAIR sequences was measured on the baseline MRI axial sequence. All subsequent scans were compared against these baseline measures (for both CE and FLAIR). New foci of FLAIR signal abnormality were recorded on each subsequent evaluation. Response was scored.
outcome.population: Nineteen patients had measurable disease at baseline and received at least one follow up scan and were evaluable for the secondary efficacy outcome measure of PFS by modified RANO criteria. None of the patients treated on this study had a reduction in tumor burden compared to baseline.

All subsequent scans were compared against these baseline measures (for both CE and FLAIR). New foci of FLAIR signal abnormality were recorded on each subsequent evaluation. Response was scored.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
